str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) intrans: I wonder, marvel, (b) trans: I wonder at, admire. From thauma; to wonder; by implication, to admire.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A spectacle, vision, that which is seen. From horao; something gazed at, i.e. A spectacle.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.
To take note of, perceive, consider carefully, discern, detect, make account of. From kata and noieo; to observe fully.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
